query.result:
**English:**
1 It was already the hour that turns the desire 2 of sailors to their homeland and softens the heart 3 on the day they have said farewell to their dear friends;
4 and that pierces the new pilgrim of love 5 if he hears a bell tolling in the distance 6 that seems to mourn the dying day;
7 when I began to lose the power 8 of hearing and to gaze at one of the souls 9 who had emerged, asking to be heard with a gesture.
**Cornish:**
1 An eur o veu an awel an awes 2 dhe'n morworyon ha'gas melys aga colon 3 an jorna ow thueth dheth dhe'n kesmeur ker.
4 Ha'gas an pilgrim nowydh a garow 5 ow klev bell ow toni a bell bell bell 6 owthueth an jorna ow mernans y'n mernans.
7 Pan wrugof vy dhe'n klev ha'gas 8 ha sel yn un a'n eneow 9 ow tos ha'gas, ow hwilas dhe'y klev gans aga dorn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Ella giunse e levò ambo le palme, 11 ficcando li occhi verso l’orïente, 12 come dicesse a Dio: ‘D’altro non calme’.
query.result:
**English:**
10 She arrived and raised both her palms, 11 fixing her eyes towards the east, 12 as if to say to God: ‘I care for nothing else’.
**Cornish:**
10 Hi a dheuth ha'gas ha'y dhew dorn, 11 ow sel aga lagha dhe'n est, 12 avel orth y lavar dhe'n Duw: ‘Nyns yw erel aral’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Aguzza qui, lettor, ben li occhi al vero, 20 ché ’l velo è ora ben tanto sottile, 21 certo che ’l trapassar dentro è leggero.
query.result:
**English:**
19 Sharpen your eyes well to the truth here, reader, 20 for the veil is now so thin, 21 that it is certainly easy to pass through it.
**Cornish:**
19 Golgh aga lagha, lenner, dhe'n gwir yn ta, 20 rag an gwisk yw lemmyn kemmys tenow, 21 sur a wra es dhe'y tremena a-dreus yn es.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Verdi come fogliette pur mo nate 29 erano in veste, che da verdi penne 30 percosse traean dietro e ventilate.
query.result:
**English:**
28 Green as newly born leaves 29 were they in robes that, beaten by green wings, 30 trailed and fluttered behind them.
**Cornish:**
28 Gweres avel foeljynnow nowydh genys 29 o esens yn jyla, ow kelli gwynn 30 ow tos owthynna haval orth aga.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 L’un poco sovra noi a star si venne, 32 e l’altro scese in l’opposita sponda, 33 sì che la gente in mezzo si contenne.
query.result:
**English:**
31 One came a little above us to stand, 32 and the other descended to the opposite bank, 33 so that the people in the middle held back.
**Cornish:**
31 Onan a dheuth bys vy dhe sevel, 32 ha'n aral a dheuth dhe'n fordh erel, 33 marow an bobel a dheuth dhe sevel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Ben discernëa in lor la testa bionda; 35 ma ne la faccia l’occhio si smarria, 36 come virtù ch’a troppo si confonda.
query.result:
**English:**
34 I could clearly make out their blond heads; 35 but my eyes could not see their faces, 36 like a faculty that is overwhelmed by too much.
**Cornish:**
34 Ytholl ow kensa yn lor an pennow gwyn; 35 mes y'n an edhen an lagha a golla, 36 avel gallusow ow tos dheugh confusa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 «Ambo vegnon del grembo di Maria», 38 disse Sordello, «a guardia de la valle, 39 per lo serpente che verrà vie via».
query.result:
**English:**
37 “Both come from the womb of Mary,” 38 said Sordello, “to guard the valley, 39 because of the serpent that will come this way.”
**Cornish:**
37 “Oll an dhew a dheuth a groth Mari”, 38 a leveris Sordello, “rag drehevel an dowr, 39 rag an sarf ow tos dhe'n fordh ma.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Ond’ io, che non sapeva per qual calle, 41 mi volsi intorno, e stretto m’accostai, 42 tutto gelato, a le fidate spalle.
query.result:
**English:**
40 Whereupon I, who did not know which way to go, 41 turned around and, trembling, drew close 42 to those trusted shoulders.
**Cornish:**
40 Ha my, nag esa gowsys drehev fordh, 41 a drohwys yn-dro ha'gas ow tos dhe'n fordh, 42 oll rewlys, dhe'n skwyddys fydhys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 E Sordello anco: «Or avvalliamo omai 44 tra le grandi ombre, e parleremo ad esse; 45 grazïoso fia lor vedervi assai».
query.result:
**English:**
43 And Sordello again: “Now let us descend 44 among the great shades, and we will speak to them; 45 it will please them greatly to see you.”
**Cornish:**
43 Ha Sordello arta: “Wrug a-dro dhe'n fordh 44 ynter an scouthow meur, ha ni a leveris; 45 lowenhe dhe'th gweles ow tos dhe'n fordh.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Solo tre passi credo ch’i’ scendesse, 47 e fui di sotto, e vidi un che mirava 48 pur me, come conoscer mi volesse.
query.result:
**English:**
46 I think I had descended only three steps, 47 and I was below, and I saw someone who was gazing 48 only at me, as if he wanted to recognize me.
**Cornish:**
46 Tri gamm hepken a leveris ow tos dhe'n fordh, 47 ha my a veu a-woles, ha'gas a welas 48 vy hepken, avel orth ow tos ow cavas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Temp’ era già che l’aere s’annerava, 50 ma non sì che tra li occhi suoi e ’ miei 51 non dichiarisse ciò che pria serrava.
query.result:
**English:**
49 It was already the time when the air was growing dark, 50 but not so much that between his eyes and mine 51 it did not reveal what it had previously concealed.
**Cornish:**
49 An eur o veu panvow an ayr ow tos dhe'n fordh, 50 mes nag esa kemmys na dheuth ynter ylagas ha'y 51 na leveris an pyth ow tos ow tos dhe'n fordh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Ver’ me si fece, e io ver’ lui mi fei: 53 giudice Nin gentil, quanto mi piacque 54 quando ti vidi non esser tra ’ rei!
55 Nullo bel salutar tra noi si tacque; 56 poi dimandò: «Quant’ è che tu venisti 57 a piè del monte per le lontane acque?».
query.result:
**English:**
52 He approached me, and I approached him: 53 noble Judge Ninus, how pleased I was 54 when I saw that you were not among the kings!
55 No courteous greeting was left unspoken between us; 56 then he asked: “How long is it since you came 57 to the foot of the mountain by the distant waters?”
**Cornish:**
52 Ev a dheuth dhe'm fordh, ha my a dheuth dhe'y fordh: 53 barnjur jentil Ninus, pyth ow lowena 54 panvow na veuvos orth ynter an reys!
55 Nag esa saluta jentil ynter ni ow tos dhe'n fordh; 56 wosa henna a leveris: “Pyth eus ow tos dhe'n fordh 57 dhe dreus an menydh rag an dowrow pell?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 «Oh!», diss’ io lui, «per entro i luoghi tristi 59 venni stamane, e sono in prima vita, 60 ancor che l’altra, sì andando, acquisti».
query.result:
**English:**
58 “Oh!” I said to him, “through the sorrowful places 59 I came this morning, and I am in my first life, 60 although I am acquiring the other as I go.”
**Cornish:**
58 “Oh!”, a leveris dhe'y, “drehev an leow trysti 59 a dheuth hedhyw, ha my yn kynsa byw, 60 byttegyns an aral, avel orth ow tos dhe'n fordh, ow tos dhe'n fordh.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 E come fu la mia risposta udita, 62 Sordello ed elli in dietro si raccolse 63 come gente di sùbito smarrita.
query.result:
**English:**
61 And when my answer was heard, 62 Sordello and he drew back 63 like people suddenly bewildered.
**Cornish:**
61 Ha pan vynedh agaghwedhel, 62 Sordello hag ev yn keffrys a-dhallathas 63 avel dus ow a-dhollas yn subet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 L’uno a Virgilio e l’altro a un si volse 65 che sedea lì, gridando: «Sù, Currado! 66 vieni a veder che Dio per grazia volse».
query.result:
**English:**
64 One turned to Virgil and the other to one 65 who was sitting there, crying out: “Up, Currado! 66 come and see what God in his grace has willed.”
**Cornish:**
64 An eyl orth Virgili hag egile orth unn 65 o osedha eno, ow kewsel: “Sef, Currado! 66 dos dhe wul Whelas dreus gras a wrug.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Poi, vòlto a me: «Per quel singular grado 68 che tu dei a colui che sì nasconde 69 lo suo primo perché, che non lì è guado,
70 quando sarai di là da le larghe onde, 71 dì a Giovanna mia che per me chiami 72 là dove a li ’nnocenti si risponde.
query.result:
**English:**
67 Then, turning to me: “By that unique favor 68 that you owe to him who so conceals 69 his first wherefore, that there is no ford there,
70 when you will be beyond the broad waves, 71 tell my Giovanna to call upon me 72 there where the innocent are answered.
**Cornish:**
67 Wosa, ow troha orthof: “Dreus an unnik grad 68 owth eus dhe dhe’n neb a-gudha 69 y gynsa kynsa hwyr, na’th eus ford eno,
70 pan voseugh owth an tu-honna tonnow, 71 leverel dhe Giovanna dhe galvos orthof 72 eno le mayth an dus anedhagon an lavarow.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Non credo che la sua madre più m’ami, 74 poscia che trasmutò le bianche bende, 75 le quai convien che, misera!, ancor brami.
query.result:
**English:**
73 I do not believe that his mother loves me more, 74 since she changed the white robes, 75 which, poor woman, she must still desire.
**Cornish:**
73 Nyns credaf vy na’y vamm a garo dhe’m moy, 74 wosa y hi throadh an gwynn wiskoedh, 75 an re beu dhe, an drus, hedhyw a gar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Per lei assai di lieve si comprende 77 quanto in femmina foco d’amor dura, 78 se l’occhio o ’l tatto spesso non l’accende.
query.result:
**English:**
76 Through her it is easily understood 77 how long the fire of love lasts in a woman, 78 if the eye or the touch does not often kindle it.
**Cornish:**
76 Dre y hi a yll vydh a-somprehendya 77 pyth pella yn benen tan tan a-bera 78 mar nas gwello po’th tevi nyns a-y tanna.

88 E ’l duca mio: «Figliuol, che là sù guarde?». 89 E io a lui: «A quelle tre facelle 90 di che ’l polo di qua tutto quanto arde».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Ond’ elli a me: «Le quattro chiare stelle 92 che vedevi staman, son di là basse, 93 e queste son salite ov’ eran quelle».
query.result:

**Cornish:**

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Tra l’erba e ’ fior venìa la mala striscia, 101 volgendo ad ora ad or la testa, e ’l dosso 102 leccando come bestia che si liscia.

query.result:
**English:**

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 «Se la lucerna che ti mena in alto 113 truovi nel tuo arbitrio tanta cera 114 quant’ è mestiere infino al sommo smalto»,
115 cominciò ella, «se novella vera 116 di Val di Magra o di parte vicina 117 sai, dillo a me, che già grande là era.
query.result:
**English:**
112 "If the lamp that leads you on high 113 finds in your free will as much wax 114 as is needed to reach the highest enamel,"
115 she began, "if you know any true news 116 of the Val di Magra or of a nearby region, 117 tell it to me, for I once lived there as a great lady.**Cornish:**
112 "An golow a'th ledyth dhe'n ughella, 113 a gav yn dha ayrbost kerys kellow 114 avel syw mester bys dhe'n enamel ughella,"
115 a dhalleth hya, "mar nowodh gwir 116 a Val di Magra po rann ogas, 117 leverel dhe'm, rag vy oas meur eno."**Cornish:**
112 "An golow a'th ledyth dhe'n ughella, 113 a gav yn dha ayrbost kerys kellow 114 avel syw mester bys dhe'n enamel ughella,"
115 a dhalleth hya, "mar nowodh gwir 116 a Val di Magra po rann ogas, 117 leverel dhe'm, rag vy oas meur eno."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 «Oh!», diss’ io lui, «per li vostri paesi 122 già mai non fui; ma dove si dimora 123 per tutta Europa ch’ei non sien palesi?
124 La fama che la vostra casa onora, 125 grida i segnori e grida la contrada, 126 sì che ne sa chi non vi fu ancora;
127 e io vi giuro, s’io di sopra vada, 128 che vostra gente onrata non si sfregia 129 del pregio de la borsa e de la spada.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Uso e natura sì la privilegia, 131 che, perché il capo reo il mondo torca, 132 sola va dritta e ’l mal cammin dispregia».
query.result:
**English:**
130 Custom and nature so privilege it, 131 that, though the wicked head turns the world awry, 132 it alone goes straight and scorns the evil path.**Cornish:**
130 Uj ha naturel a'y previlig, 131 rag, dre henna, pan dro an pen kledh an bys, 132 hi a dheuth yn unnik ha'n fordh drok a omdispris.**Cornish:**
130 Uj ha naturel a'y previlig, 131 rag, dre henna, pan dro an pen kledh an bys, 132 hi a dheuth yn unnik ha'n fordh drok a omdispris.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Ed elli: «Or va; che ’l sol non si ricorca 134 sette volte nel letto che ’l Montone 135 con tutti e quattro i piè cuopre e inforca,
136 che cotesta cortese oppinïone 137 ti fia chiavata in mezzo de la testa 138 con maggior chiovi che d’altrui sermone,
139 se corso di giudicio non s’arresta».
query.result:
**English:**
133 And he: “Now go; for the sun will not set 134 seven times in the bed that Aries 135 covers and bestrides with all four feet,
136 before this gracious opinion 137 will be nailed into the middle of your head 138 with greater nails than another’s sermon,
139 if the course of justice is not stopped.”
**Cornish:**
133 Ha henna: “Wrug a-lemmyn; rag an howl na wra dalleth 134 seyth gweyth y’n gwely henna a wra’n Mernans 135 gans oll peswar an tros a wra kovra ha’y ha’n fordh,
136 rag an brederyans grasus ma 137 a vydh klavyes yn kres an dha ben 138 gans klavow moy ages ev golon aral,
139 mar naso an fordh a varnas.”
